intro: Nicolsonia orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco nicolsonia, is a rare flowering plant native to Venezuela. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within the Orinoco River basin. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
